children.value: This notebook provides you an introduction to the
and gives you a practical example how to access and retrieve data from the ADS.
2.1 - Access data interactively via the ADS web interface
2.2 - Access data programmatically with the CDS API
Run the tutorial via free cloud platforms:
is the data access portal of the
and offers access to data about the
Earth's past, present and future atmosphere
There are two ways to access data from the Copernicus Atmosphere Data Store (ADS):
via the ADS web interface, or
In order to be able to access data from the Atmosphere Data Store (ADS), you first have to
at the ADS registration page (if you do not have an account yet) and second, you have to
to the ADS portal. You will be able to browse the ADS web interface without beging logged in, but you have to login for being able to download data.
2.1 Access data interactively via the ADS web interface

children.label: 2.1 Access data interactively via the ADS web interface

children.value: data products offered by the ADS. First, under
, you can browse and select the data you are interested in. In a second step, you can specify details of the data download form you wish to submit.
In a first step, you can
the datasets you are interested in. The
interface allows you either to select data based on different categories, e.g.
, but also offers a free text search. The list of datasets in the main window allows you to select the dataset you are interested in.
Once you selected a dataset, you then get redirected to a
section, which provides you an overview of the chosen dataset. Under
, you have the option to specify the dataset you would like to download and to submit the download form.
section (see 1 in the image below) provides you an overview of the dataset, including a list of variables that are available. Under the tab
opens (see 2), which allows you to interactively filter the dataset based on specific keywords, such as:
, you get two options to select:
. If you want to download the data interactively, the data requests will be executed as soon as you click on the
You need to be logged into the ADS portal and you have to accept the Terms and Conditions of the dataset before being able to download data.
, if you want to request data programmatically. See
in the main menu, you can monitor the status of your data requests.
2.2 Access data programmatically with the CDS API

children.label: 2.2 Access data programmatically with the CDS API

children.value: is a Python library which allows you to access data from the ADS
. The library is available for both Python versions, Python 2.7.x and Python 3, but we recommend to use the library under Python 3. In order to use the CDS API, follow the steps below:
at the ADS registration page (if you do not have an account yet)
to the ADS portal and go to the
Copy the CDS API key displayed in the black terminal window in a file under
You find your CDS API key displayed in the black terminal box under the section
. If you do not see a URL or key appear in the black terminal box, please refresh your browser tab.
The code below creates the file under your current working directory. Make sure to replace the

The Copernicus Climate Change Service (C3S) uses the same CDS API software, but provides access to different datasets. If you are accessing data also from the Copernicus Climate Data Store and you already have a
file created, then you have to store your ADS key elsewhere.
You can e.g. store your ADS key under
and you can pass the key information to the client library explicitly. See the code cell below how to do this.

import cdsapi
import yaml

with open ('./.adsapirc', 'r') as f:
    credentials= yaml.safe_load(f)
    
print(credentials)
print(credentials['url'])
print(credentials['key'])
c = cdsapi.Client(url=credentials['url'], key="18949:"+credentials['key'])
Alternative: Set CDS API credentials manually

children.label: Alternative: Set CDS API credentials manually

children.value: Alternatively, you can also define variables for
. These variables can then be set when you define the
(see next section for the different components of a data retrieval request).
in the workflow notebooks, we will use this modality and set manually the CDS API key information for the data retrievals.
The next step is to install the
. You can do this with the package management system

children.value: Use the CDS API client for data access

children.label: Use the CDS API client for data access

children.value: is installed, it can be used to request data from the Atmosphere Data Store.
Below, you see the principle of a
request. You always have to make sure to first
before you are able to execute an
to browse through the datasets. At the end of the
, there is the option to choose
. If you click this button, the
appears (see example below), which you can copy paste into your coding workflow.
you have to accept the Terms and Conditions of the dataset through the ADS web interface before you are able to request data via the CDS API.

For data originating from ECMWF's Meteorological and Archival System (MARS), data is stored on a grid with longitudes from 0 to 360 degrees. It can be reprojected to a regular geographic latitude-longitude grid, by setting the keyword argument
. Per default, data is retrieved in
. If you wish to retrieve the data in
, you have to specify it by using the keyword argument
Common Error Messages for CDS Requests
Example: CAMS global atmospheric composition forecasts - Organic matter aerosol optical depth at 550 nm

children.label: Example: CAMS global atmospheric composition forecasts - Organic matter aerosol optical depth at 550 nm

children.value:
import cdsapi
c = cdsapi.Client(url=URL, key=KEY)
c.retrieve(
    'cams-global-atmospheric-composition-forecasts',
    {
        'date': '2021-08-01/2021-08-08',
        'type': 'forecast',
        'format': 'netcdf_zip',
        'variable': 'organic_matter_aerosol_optical_depth_550nm',
        'time': '00:00',
        'leadtime_hour': [
            '0', '12', '18',
            '6',
        ],
        'area': [
            80, -150, 25,
            -50,
        ],
    },
    './2021-08_NAmerica_organicMatterAOD.zip')
